content: Family General Lifestyle Travel Asked by AnonymousAsked 3w agoAre the topics covered in this group able to be applied to New Zealand?Where can I find similar information for New Zealand?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered 3w agoMost of it is actually localised to Singapore's context such as local retirement schemes, housing. However, general investing principles and strategy is applicable globally. For example, concepts like value investing are not restricted to any specific country.0 comments1

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered 3w agoYes to most of the investment stuff like buying ETF for lowest fees, buying stocks, bonds etc. Yes to robo-advisors if NZ have robo-advisors (they all work on the same principle- low fees and taking human emotions out of investing)No to SGD related stuff, such as CPF, housing (HDB has its own weird local rules), Singapore Saving bonds (if you are spending in NZD, an SGD-bond is not as safe as an NZD-bonds) etc0 comments0
